translations.literal: (Liu Song of Southern Dynasties) Fan Ye
translations.idiomatic: (Liu Song dynasty of the Southern Dynasties) Fan Ye

sentences.zh: (西晉) 司馬彪 〈（《續漢書》作者，有八〈志〉30卷補入范曄所著《後漢書》）〉

translations.literal: (Western Jin) Sima Biao ((author of 'Xu Han Shu', has eight 'zhi' 30 volumes supplementing Fan Ye's 'Hou Han Shu'))
translations.idiomatic: (Western Jin dynasty) Sima Biao ((author of the 'Xu Han Shu', contributed eight treatises in 30 volumes supplementing Fan Ye's 'Book of Later Han'))

sentences.zh: 註：(唐) 章懷太子 李賢

translations.literal: Commentary: (Tang) Crown Prince Zhanghuai Li Xian
translations.idiomatic: Commentary: (Tang dynasty) Crown Prince Zhanghuai, Li Xian

sentences.zh: 《後漢書》是一部記載東漢歷史的紀傳體史書。

translations.literal: The 'Book of Later Han' is a dynastic history in the annal-biography format that records the history of the Eastern Han dynasty.
translations.idiomatic: The Book of Later Han is a dynastic history written in the traditional annal-biography format, chronicling the Eastern Han dynasty.

sentences.zh: 書中分十紀、八十列傳和八志（司馬彪續作）。

translations.literal: The book is divided into ten annals, eighty biographies, and eight treatises (continued by Sima Biao).
translations.idiomatic: The work is divided into ten imperial annals, eighty biographical accounts, and eight monographic treatises (with the treatises continued by Sima Biao).

sentences.zh: 紀和列傳的作者是南朝劉宋時的范曄。

translations.literal: The author of the annals and biographies is Fan Ye of the Liu Song dynasty of the Southern Dynasties.
translations.idiomatic: The annals and biographies were written by Fan Ye during the Liu Song dynasty of the Southern Dynasties.

sentences.zh: 北宋真宗時，有人把晉朝司馬彪的《續漢書》八志三十卷與之合刊，成為今天的《後漢書》。

translations.literal: During the reign of Emperor Zhenzong of the Northern Song, someone combined Sima Biao's eight treatises and thirty volumes from his 'Xu Han Shu' with it, forming today's 'Book of Later Han'.
translations.idiomatic: During the reign of Emperor Zhenzong of the Northern Song dynasty, Sima Biao's eight treatises and thirty volumes from his Xu Han Shu were combined with Fan Ye's work, forming the Book of Later Han as we know it today.
